Antarctica and exhibit women with pictures.  Tattooing is a

Morocco. Even though he had to use a wheelchair after a mountain climbing accident,
a British explorer still
plans to cross Antarctica in the snow.
He hopes that his attempt to set a record
will inspire him.  Inspiration not only for
those with injuries but also for
anyone going through a
challenging period in their
lives. Explorer Darren Edwards has been paralyzed
from the chest down since 2016. He
plans to cross the 333km Quang Duong in
expedition this December
Edwards and two team members will
have to trek through snow and ice for up to 12 hours a
day carrying 80 kg of equipment. He will
use a converted snow rig
that includes a sit-on  The
specially designed helmet is attached to the
driver's hand and relies on the nerves on the
skin and arm to create movement.
Edwards hopes to donate
300,000 copies to support
research and treatment organizations.  Spinal Cord Injury
Wings For Life helps people
with spinal cord injuries return to their
former lives after paralysis.
Edwards has completed a number of
daring expeditions including the
occipital ice traverse.  the largest in Europe
and the C-jack sailing trip across
England

this month. Like many other Asian countries,
flower markets during the Lunar New Year are always popular.  The
most visited place and the
flower market in Shanghai is one such place. The Lunar

Hongqiao in Shanghai is bustling with
market buyers. Hongqiao is one of the
largest flower markets.  and the most famous in
Shanghai is located in Hongqiao Park. This
place attracts a large number of people
and visitors during the period near the
Lunar New Year. People
like to buy peony tangerines because they symbolize  The
coming year means good luck and the peony
symbolizes wealth. It seems that
before every Tet holiday, the market
becomes bright with the colors of a variety of
pastries and ornamental plants on sale at the store.  Here, Dia
Lang and Phong Lang are the
most popular varieties each year.
In addition, Anthurium cambam,
daffodil and Quoc are very popular almost every year,
not only attracting
locals, but also tourists.  Come here to
feel the hustle and bustle of the
approaching Lunar New Year atmosphere
in this billion-dollar country.
